co.cask.cdap.api.messaging

Interface MessagingContext

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CustomActionContext, FlowletContext, HttpServiceContext, MapReduceContext, SparkClientContext, WorkerContext, WorkflowContext

    @Beta
public interface MessagingContext
    Provides access to the transactional messaging system.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MessagePublisher getDirectMessagePublisher()
      Gets an instance of MessagePublisher for publishing messages.
      MessageFetcher getMessageFetcher()
      Gets an instance of MessageFetcher for fetching messages.
      MessagePublisher getMessagePublisher()
      Gets an instance of MessagePublisher for publishing messages.

    • Method Detail

      • getMessagePublisher

        MessagePublisher getMessagePublisher()
        Gets an instance of MessagePublisher for publishing messages.

        Messages will be published transactionally if any of the publish methods in the MessagePublisher is called from a transactional context (either through Implicit Transaction Control, or via Transactional.execute(TxRunnable) when Explicit Transaction Control is used).

        When those publish methods are called without a transactional context, message will be published without transaction.

        Returns:
        a new instance of MessagePublisher. The returned instance cannot be shared across multiple threads.

      • getDirectMessagePublisher

        MessagePublisher getDirectMessagePublisher()
        Gets an instance of MessagePublisher for publishing messages. Messages published through the resulting MessagePublisher is always published without using transaction and is immediately available for consumption.
        Returns:
        a new instance of MessagePublisher. The returned instance is safe to be used from multiple threads.

      • getMessageFetcher

        MessageFetcher getMessageFetcher()
        Gets an instance of MessageFetcher for fetching messages.

        Messages will be fetched transactionally if any of the fetch methods in the MessageFetcher is called from a transactional context (either through Implicit Transaction Control, or via Transactional.execute(TxRunnable) when Explicit Transaction Control is used).

        When those fetch methods are called without a transactional context, message will be fetched without transaction.

        Returns:
        a new instance of MessageFetcher. The returned instance cannot be shared across multiple threads.
